metadata.title: CVE-2017-11089 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, with all Androidreleases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overread is observed innl80211_set_station when user space application sends attributeNL80211_ATTR_LOCAL_MESH_POWER_MODE with data of size less than 4 bytes

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11089` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-lowlatency - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1071-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1071.79
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1073-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1073.78
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1032-aws - 4.4.0-1032.41
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2

linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1028-gke - 4.4.0-1028.28
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1028-gke - 4.4.0-1028.28
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-93.116').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1071.79').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1073.78').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1032.41').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1028.28').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
